Write a real-valued function TriangleP(a, h) that returns the perimeter of an isosceles triangle with given base a and altitude h (a and h are real numbers). Using this function, find the perimeters of three triangles with given bases and altitudes. Note that the leg b of an isosceles triangle can be found by the Pythagorean theorem: b2 = (a/2)2 + h2.
